ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Deduplication with Heritrix 1.12
ygData.msgSnippet: You don t need to use both. I think you just want the PersistStoreProcessor as it s somewhat easier to use. Make sure you re re-using the state directory from

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Deduplication with Heritrix 1.12
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=278782393; y=Hk9vi2VhMlP94YMOoXHbK-K1UcLjEFTjfr9qLfXALtbeMzS9eQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: poetbeware

You don't need to use both. I think you just want the  
PersistStoreProcessor as it's somewhat easier to use.

Make sure you're re-using the state directory from the first crawl in  
the recrawl. You can either copy the state directory from the  
previous crawl to the new crawl, or use PersistProcessor.main as  
described in the wiki.

Another possible explanation is that you may have encountered a crawl  
trap. Such a trap could produce the same content over and over, but  
with different URIs each time. In that event the  
FetchHistoryProcessor won't detect a duplicate due to the differing  
URIs.

Hope that helps,

-Paul


On Jul 23, 2007, at 6:05 AM, Natalia Torres wrote:

> Hello
>
> I'm testing Heritrix 1.12 because i'm interested in dedup feature.
>
> I read on wiki notes on using the new duplication-reduction  
> functionality.
>
> What's the difference betwen use PersistLogProcessor or
> PersistStoreProcessor?
>
> I try both to get the initial crawl using my www as example and it  
> woks
> ok (getting about 700Mb on arc files). But when i recrawl, the size of
> arc created with crawl data is similar to the initial ( the web has  
> few
> changes but also crawl 700Mb )
>
> Thanks
>
> N.
>
>
